dublin_core.dcvalue: As human will stay for long duration in isolated sites like ISS there will be a need to perform quick and reliable diagnosis to evaluate the gravity of the pathology in presence of clinical symptoms Many pathological situations abnormal heart rate pericardic collection mitral prolaps cholecystis renal lithiasis normal and ectopic pregnancies ovarian cyst acute appendicitis phlebitis may occur even if all the astronauts are absolutely normal and healthy preflight Ultrasound echography and Doppler are non invasive methods easy to use in space and very well adapted and used in routine for such diagnosis at the hospital The objective of the present project was to design a method that guarantee a reliable echographic diagnostic in an isolated site space station or earth site by a Medical Doctor located at the expert site that should be the Nasa control center for ISS It is supposed that there is only a non sonographer person in the isolated site and that the transmission system audio video numeric is the only link between the 2 sites Two options are proposed a A 3D realtime acquisition echograph that can record quickly all the echos of a volume containing the organ suspected to have a lesion all these echo information being sent to the ground and processed by the ground experts b A robotic arm that hangs the echo probe in the isolated site tele operated through sattelite network from the ground by an expert in clinical ultrasound As the expert moves the joystick of his ground computer the robotic arm reproduces the same movements on the probe
